intro: Aulospermum aboriginum, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, gray-green leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its succulent stems and deep root system. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Aulospermum aboriginum plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
